alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Charleston; Coastal Colleton; Dorchester; Inland Berkeley; Inland Colleton; Tidal Berkeley (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 9:02PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BEAUFORT, CHARLESTON, COLLETON, BERKELEY AND DORCHESTER COUNTIES... At 902 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cape Island to near McClellanville to near Daniel Island to Magnolia Gardens to near Givhans to near Cottageville, and moving south at 55 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of these storms include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Summerville, Goose Creek, Hanahan, McClellanville, Edisto Beach and Fort Sumter. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify. Be certain to monitor local radio and TV stations as well as local cable TV outlets for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
